plan:
Given my value, I will start by bidding half of it. This will allow me to gather data on how the other bidders are acting without risking too much. If others are consistently bidding high, I'll increase my bid incrementally to stay competitive. If they bid low, I'll adjust downwards to maximize profit. 

If I bid down while others bid high, I lose the prize but risk less. If I bid up while others bid low, I win but may overpay. 

I'll deviate from my strategy based on patterns observed. If Betty consistently bids high, I might bid aggressively to outbid her. If Charles is conservative, I may lower my bid to maximize profit.

Round 1: Bid 50% of my value. This is a conservative start to gather data on how aggressive other bidders are.

Round 2-4: Increase bid to 75% of my value. This will test if higher bids lead to more wins, and how much profit can be made.

Round 5-7: Bid aggressively at 100% of my value. This will test the upper limit of bidding and potential profit.

Round 8-10: Bid randomly between 50% and 100% of my value. This will add unpredictability and test the effectiveness of varying bids.

Round 1: Bid value + 10%. This establishes a baseline and allows observation of competitors' strategies. 

Round 2-3: Bid aggressively, value + 30%. This tests competitors' reactions to high bids. 

Round 4-5: Bid conservatively, value - 10%. This tests competitors' reactions to low bids. 

Round 6-7: Bid randomly within 10-90% of value. This adds unpredictability and allows data collection on a wider range of bids. 

Round 8-10: Bid based on previous round results. If consistent winning, bid lower. If consistently losing, bid higher. 

Round 11-15: Refine strategy based on collected data, aiming to maximize profit.

I plan to bid slightly above the highest bid from the previous round, as this strategy could potentially win the auction. I'll also observe Betty and Charles' bidding patterns to adjust my strategy accordingly.
